section.title: Introduction
section.para: The &alp; (&alpshort;) is a minimal operating system that runs containerized workloads. You can run it on a bare metal host, virtualized, or in a cloud environment. This article describes how to deploy &alpshort; on a &vmhost; with the &kvm; hypervisor.

section.title: Deploying &alpshort; as a &kvm; virtual machine
section.para: This procedure describes steps to deploy &alpshort; as a &kvm; virtual machine using the &vmm;.

step.para: Download &alpshort; virtual machine image on the host where you will run &alpshort;. Go to &alp-dld-site;, and download the latest disk image of &alpshort;. For example:
Start &vmm;, select FileNew VM and select Import existing disk image. Confirm with Forward.
Specify the path to the &alpshort; virtual machine image that you previously downloaded and the type of linux OS you are deploying, for example Generic Linux 2020. Confirm with Forward.
Specify the amount of memory and number of processor that you want to dedicate the &alpshort; virtual machine and confirm with Forward.
Specify name for the virtual machine and a network to be used, and confirm with Finish.
The newly created virtual machine will boot the &alpshort; disk image, presenting you with a bootloader screen. Select &alpshort; and hit .
After the virtual machine boots, it displays the &jeos; Firstboot screen. Confirm with .
On the next screens, select keyboard, confirm the license agreement, and select the time zone.
In the Enter root password dialog window, enter a password for the &rootuser; and confirm it once more.

section.title: Summary
section.para: After the deployment of &alpshort; is finished, you are presented with the login prompt. Log in as &rootuser; and you are ready to setup the system and install additional workloads and applications.
